title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 November 2016 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:18 <vmassol> has quit  
04:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
06:13 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
06:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <mflorea> has quit  
08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Hi  
09:32 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Since I updated Xwiki 8.0 to 8.4.3, I have this error :  
09:32 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: schema « http » does not exist         at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2270)         at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1998)         at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:255)         at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execu  
09:32 <vmassol> Hi  
09:32 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> How can I fix ?  
09:32 <vmassol> are you using the FR language?  
09:32 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Yes  
09:33 <vmassol> I think it's caused by a transaltion for the Tips panel  
09:33 <vmassol> do this:  
09:33 <vmassol> (see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA-214)  
09:33 <vmassol> so you navigate to  
09:33 <vmassol> Help.Translations  
09:33 <vmassol> edit  
09:34 <vmassol> you should see this line:  
09:34 <vmassol> help.tipsPanel.gettingStartedTip=Si vous débutez avec XWiki, consultez le [[Guide de démarrage>> http\://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/]].  
09:34 <vmassol> remove the space between ">>" and "http"  
09:34 <vmassol> and save  
09:34 <vmassol> note that this error in the log is not going to affect your wiki  
09:34 <vmassol> it'll just lead to a broken link in the Tips panel for this tip  
09:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> \o/  
09:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Thank you !  
09:40 <vmassol> yw  
09:44 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has quit  
09:48 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

11:55 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <msmeria> has quit  
11:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:11 <martinus\_\_> Hi There , I have a scripting request :  I have a xwiki document that contains a <script> section with javascript code. It seems  I have access to the $xcontext var from there, how is it possible as it runs on browser side ?  
12:19 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: you probably have a {{velocity}} macro around it  
12:19 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, yes  
12:19 <vmassol> so it gets served to the client after having had velocity executed on it  
12:20 <vmassol> btw it's not a good practice to have JS code in a doc, you should use a JSX instead  
12:21 <vmassol> (but that's a detail)  
12:21 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, indeed, I observe I have no occurence to "xcontext" in the served page :D  
12:21 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, thanks  
12:21 <vmassol> np  
12:22 <vmassol> my turn to ask a question!  
12:23 <vmassol> guys, when I call the inline action with a template, can I pass some xobject property to be filled automatically?  
12:23 <vmassol> (so that they appear in the form displayed in edit)  
12:23 <martinus\_\_> not a question in my scope of knowledge :D  
12:24 <vmassol> format is: <full class ref>\_<propertyname>?  
12:24 <vmassol> testing  
12:32 <vmassol> hmm no doesn't seem to be supported  
12:32 <vmassol> mflorea, tmortagne: could you confirm?  
12:33 <mflorea> vmassol: sure  
12:34 <vmassol> WDYM? :)  
12:34 <mflorea> maybe you didn't use the right key for the property  
12:34 <tmortagne> I think you also need the object number in the key  
12:34 <vmassol> ah yes  
12:34 <mflorea> ofc  
12:34 <tmortagne> looks at the generated form  
12:34 <vmassol> yep good idea tmortagne  
12:35 <vmassol> thx  
12:35 <vmassol> works thanks  
12:42 <vmassol> anyone sees why this:  
12:42 <vmassol> #set ($reference = $services.model.createDocumentReference('', ['License', 'Data'], $licenseId))  
12:43 <vmassol> leads to URL of: /License, Data/<licenseid>  
12:43 <vmassol> the model SS has the method:  
12:43 <vmassol> public DocumentReference createDocumentReference(String wiki, List<String> spaces, String page)  
12:43 <vmassol> must be somerthing stupid but I can't see the problem and I need to borrow some pair of eyes :)  
12:46 <vmassol> it's as if the public DocumentReference createDocumentReference(String wiki, String space, String page) signature is used somehow but that would be weird  
12:47 <vmassol> if nobody sees the problem, I'll have to debug, going for lunch first!  
13:26 <vmassol> hmm must be something else since when I try this standalone it works  
13:26 <vmassol> debugging  
13:34 <vmassol> understood!  
14:49 <edvorg> has quit  
15:00 <vmassol> hmm BTW I cannot administer a nested page in the distirbution generated by the pakager mojo, need to find out hwhy  
15:00 <vmassol> (no menu)  
15:00 <vmassol> ah I know  
15:00 <vmassol> need admin-ui  
15:04 <fcharton> has quit  
15:07 <vmassol> hmm now that I have admin ui it's still missing all the permissions in the LT. That's potentially a missing dep in the admin ui module  
15:07 <vmassol> need to check what module is required for that  
15:08 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <vmassol> and also to have AdminGroup  
15:08 <vmassol> distribution-flavor fro this one…hmm  
15:09 <vmassol> ok I just need some group actually  
15:11 <vmassol> btw  
15:11 <vmassol> it's not that nice to require administration-ui to have Configurable class but it's enough for now
